author: Tom Nolan
title: Mysteries: A Homicide Disguised
text:
‘Don’t you read mystery novels?” With that question, veteran Norwegian police investigator Hanne Wilhelmsen teases her protégé, Detective Henrik Holme, in Anne Holt’s “In Dust and Ashes” (Scribner, 307 pages, $26). “At the beginning,” Hanne goes on to note, “the reader is presented with two seemingly unrelated cases. But it turns out eventually that they are linked. Always, without exception.”
In Ms. Holt’s latest—and, it’s said, final—novel featuring the brilliant and wheelchair-bound Hanne, the author deploys one of detective...
